p: TPCs for intertidal species can be estimated through physiological experiments measuring movement speed ( Tepler et al., 2011 ), respiration rate ( Marshall et al., 2010 ) and heart rate ( Dong et al., 2017 ), and there is a growing body of data for various intertidal species. Figure 7 is an example of a spatially explicit relative performance model that combines a generic TPC with a T opt of 28°C and a lethal temperature of 35°C ( Fig. 6), with a DEM from the Fort Beach site over the course of 6 h. Here, a performance is divided into categories of suboptimal, optimal, sublethal and lethal (after Kish et al., 2016 ).
